verbLexeme: 1. To be fully aware of something, or to be paying full attention to what is happening. English = (be) alert, (be) wide-awake.
2. To be very surprised about something. English = (be) astonished.
3. To admire something or to understand the importance of it. English = (be) impressed.
nominalLexeme: 1. The state of being fully aware of something, or to be paying full attention to what is happening. English = alertness.
2. A feeling of great surprise about something. English = astonishment.
